page.title: 02RATHO VILLAGE
page.content: BECAUSE THE VILLAGE LIES TO THE WEST OF EDINBURGH, MANY OF THE PEOPLE IN RATHO COMMUTE THERE TO WORK. IN A SURVEY IT WAS FOUND THAT ABOUT 50% OF THE WORKING PEOPLE TRAVEL TO EDINBURGH WHILE ABOUT 35% WORK IN SURROUNDING TOWNS LIKE LIVINGSTON OR BATHGATE. ONLY ABOUT 15% OF THE WORKING PEOPLE HAVE JOBS IN, OR NEAR TO, THE VILLAGE. ONE OF THE CONSEQUENCES OF THE VILLAGE BEING IN A RURAL SETTING IS THAT MANY FAMILIES HAVE MORE THAN ONE CAR. OVER 35% OF THE FAMILIES HAVE MORE THAN ONE VEHICLE IN THE FAMILY. IN A SURVEY CARRIED OUT THIS YEAR IT WAS FOUND THAT NEARLY 60% OF THE PEOPLE IN RATHO HAD STAYED IN THE VILLAGE FOR A PERIOD OF LESS THAN TEN YEARS. THE MAIN INFLUX OF PEOPLE CAME MAINLY FROM SURROUNDING VILLAGES AND TOWNS LIKE EDINBURGH WITH ABOUT 2% COMING FROM PLACES FURTHER AFIELD.
